channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report X-2023071211
item.description:
Report X-2023071211

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the shipment upside down in a hazmat tote. upon inspection found there to b 6 4-liter inner boxes. 0ne of the inner boxes has leaked out all of its contents. 2 of the inner boxes are fully regulated(un1993), 3 of the inner boxes are non-regulated. the one that is damaged is un-regulated, the contents of spilled out and damaged the boxes of all other inner boxes. DescribePack: the cap and seal failed causing the contents to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was put into a damaged hazmat was put into a plastic spill bag, then into a Damaged hazmat tote. lastly it was put into the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023070991
item.description:
Report X-2023070991

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: found in the hazmat cage. looks as if the box was dropped. DescribePack: One of the three plastic bottles had a loose and miss aligned cap. a trace amount leaked out. The inner packing material or the lack thereof contributed to the damage and leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was put into a plastic spill bag and then into a black tote.

item.title: Report X-2023071172
item.description:
Report X-2023071172

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: GREEN BAY
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was pulled off trailer leaking. QA was called over and package was brought to the QA work area. Package has a sharp cut on exterior packaging, this was deep enough to get one of the bottles inside, causing leakage. Package handlers did not have further information on the situation. DescribePack: Small 1inch cut on bottom side of container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Immediate call to QA.

item.title: Report X-2023070968
item.description:
Report X-2023070968

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the box in the hazmat cage. Upon first inspection found the box wet and torn open. Appears that someone tried to re-tap the box, not sure if this was pre leak or not. The plastic bottle inside filled with sulfuric acid did have a slightly loose cap, it seems that not much of the contents has leaked out. The other theory is that the box was leaked on by another package. and the contents didn't leak out. DescribePack: The cap may have been loose enough to leak. or the box was leaked on by another package. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: The shippment was put into a red damaged hazmat tote with a plastic spill bag around it.

item.title: Report X-2023070899
item.description:
Report X-2023070899

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023070899 SequenceEvent: Found the drum in the hazmat cage. Once inspected found the drum dented and the top loose and leaking. DescribePack: the top is loose and is leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: All was put into a plastic spill bag and then into a black tote. 2. X-2023070901 SequenceEvent: Found the metal drum leaking out paint from a small dent in the bottom seam. DescribePack: The bottom seam is dented and leaking. DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: the shipment was put into a plastic spill bag and then into a black tote.

item.title: Report X-2023061451
item.description:
Report X-2023061451

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE PINK SLIDE. AFTER ARRIVING WEARING PROPER PPE REPONDER NOTICED A LARGE PUDDLE ON THE SLIDE AND THE GROUND UNDER THE SLIDE. RESPONDER TOLD EMPLOYEES TO LEAVE THE AREA WHEN IT WAS SEEN THAT A HAZMAT WAS LEAKING. PROCCEDED TO FOLLOW THE DESCISION TREE TO PROPERLY CLEAN UP SPILL AND RETURN TO DMP FOR PROCCESSING.
